result.execSummary:
Ladarius J Snipes was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Ladarius J Snipes was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ladarius J Snipes

defendant.name: Snipes, Ladarius J
defendant.address: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
09:17 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Ladarius J Snipes did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has been extradited.
Defense requests matter be dismissed.
State moves to administratively close the case.
Court grants motion and orders case closed.
Status conference on May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:47 AM Defendant Ladarius J Snipes in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests an extradition hearing set within 30 days.
State advises they don't see specific time limits for the hearing.
Court will set a status hearing for the filing of a Habeas Corpus.
State requests bail be revoked at this time.
Defense objects to bail being revoked.
Court orders bail revoked pending further order of the Court.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Governor's Warrant.
Review hearing on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:36 AM Defendant Ladarius J Snipes in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests an extension of 30 days for the governor's warrant.  Defense has no objection.  Court grants request and will set a review hearing in 30 days.
Defense requests to address bail.  Arguments by the Defense.  Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bail.  
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  Review hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ladarius J Snipes
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2022)
Prior: 6625 N. 103rd St, Milwaukee, WI 55325
Review hearing on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no new law violations.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. 
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

09:28 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court, defendant Ladarius J Snipes not in court, in custody.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court to address the status of the Governor's warrant.
State does not yet have the Governor's warrant.
State is requesting a 60 day extension.
Defense objects to the extension.
Court grants the extension.
Defense is requesting that the time start running today 2/25/22.
Statements by the states the time should start running on 3/2/22.
Court will start the time running on 3/2/22.


Defense address the issue of bail, requesting cash bail and places arguments on the record.
State places arguments on the record.
Defense places rebuttal arguments on the record.
Court sets cash bail at $750,000.00

  Review hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Warrant For Commitment signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on February 10, 2022.
Review hearing on February 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

11:21 AM Defendant Ladarius J Snipes in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court to address extradition request from the State of Minnesota.

Defendant is contesting the extradition to the State of Minnesota and requesting an extradition hearing.
State requests the Court sign the Warrant for Commitment and start the time running effective 2/10/22, to allow them to obtain the Governor's warrant.

Defense is requesting the Court sign the warrant for commitment, but start the time effective the date he was taken into custody on 1/31/22 or the date of his initial appearance on 2/1/22.
Court will sign the Order for Commitment and start the time running effective 2/1/22.

State to file request with the State of Minnesota for Governor's warrant. 
Matter put over for 30 days.
If Governor's warrant not received for the next court date, the State may request a 60 day extension.
If no Governor's warrant is filed within that time frame the Court will address possible dismissal.  Review hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez
Hearing on February 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:11 PM Defendant Ladarius J Snipes in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and supporting documentation and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defendant contest extradition.  Court denies bail at this time.  Hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
